result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Grimaldi Rashaam Figueroa-Colon in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense is missing some discovery  and request a status date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Grimaldi Rashaam Figueroa-Colon in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Grimaldi Rashaam Figueroa-Colon in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Chwaszozewski.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Johnson in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No driving without a valid license and proper vehicle registration.

Defendant Grimaldi Rashaam Figueroa-Colon in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with
